Comment: We need to disambiguate this use of the term from the stratum moleculare
Hippocampal molecular layer.Definition: A cytoarchitectural region of the hippocampus consisting of a composite of the two outermost layers of the hippocampus, the Stratum lacunosum-moleculare and the Stratum radiatum (Carpenter-83).  In CA3, there is an additional layer lying above the pyramidal cell layer, the stratum lucidum, which is also included here.
